meanings.sent1: After the storm, they had to relighting the candles in the house.
meanings.sent2: She forgot to relighting the campfire before going to bed.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved relighting the same candle multiple times.
meanings.sent4: His smile relighting her heart like a flame in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The sun relighting the sky with vibrant colors at dawn.

meanings.definition: The act of lighting or igniting again.
meanings.sent1: The relighting of the lantern brought warmth to the room.
meanings.sent2: He enjoyed watching the relighting of the fireworks display.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected relighting of the bonfire startled everyone around.
meanings.sent4: The relighting of hope in her eyes was a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent5: The relighting of the cityscape at night was a breathtaking view.
